data.title: A $100,000 Bugatti-Clobbering Race Car For The Street -- /TUNED
data.description: The LS3-powered Drakan is small, nimble and has the same power-to-weight ratio as a Bugatti Veyron. But despite its racecar looks, it won't shatter your spine if you drive it on the street. With Matt Farah.

asset.title: A $100,000 Bugatti-Clobbering Race Car For The Street -- /TUNED
asset.description:
The LS3-powered Drakan is small, nimble and has the same power-to-weight ratio as a Bugatti Veyron. But despite its racecar looks, it won't shatter your spine if you drive it on the street. With Matt Farah. http://www.drakancars.com

data.title: The World's Fastest Lotus? - /TUNED
data.description: Frank Profera has spent six years making his Lotus go faster, stop shorter, and corner harder. Though it only has to move around 2,150 lbs, Frank's Lotus makes 680 wheel horsepower with a twin-charged 1.8L engine; giving it a better power-to-weight ratio than Mario Andretti's Formula One Lotus.  It's an ongoing project that may never be finished, because of Frank's never-ending obsession with speed. We had to take it for a ride.

data.title: The Secrets Of Car And Driver's Lightning Lap Revealed - /DRIVEN
data.description:
Go behind the scenes with Car and Driver magazine editors as they pummel Virginia International Raceway for three days with 25 of the world’s best sports cars.

Their object is to set benchmark lap times that compare a cars’ performance against other cars in its price range. They publish the results once a year in the Lightning Lap issue. 

Exciting? Yes. Easy? Hardly. Here’s a behind-the-scenes look at how they do it.

asset.title: The Secrets Of Car And Driver's Lightning Lap Revealed - /DRIVEN

data.title: Ferrari, Ferrari, Ferrari - /DRIVE on NBC Sports: EP05  PT3
data.description:
On this episode of /DRIVE on NBC Sports, it's all about Ferrari. The icon in red. Racing heritage, brand cache, performance, they have it all. And now they have their own episode.


The La Ferrari is their newest in a long line of super performance cars, and Chris Harris goes to Italy to find out if it's worth all the press.

But first, Mike Spinelli investigates the story of a car that spent a lot of its life in hiding, buried in dirt. Yes, what once was the greatest home an earthworm ever had, is back on the road.

data.title: Nissan GT-R Track Pack v Porsche 997 Turbo S - /CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS
data.tags: NIssan GT-R, Porsche 911 Turbo, Chris Harris
data.description: It's been raining in England for the past 6 weeks, so this is a damp test. The GT-R Track Pack seems a bit half-hearted and, on-paper, the 997 Turbo S is the closest rival. I went to an evening track event at Brands Hatch to discover the differences/ work out if the Track pack is worth the extra cash.

data.title: Le Mans Legends 2013: Chris Harris Drives a Lister Jaguar Coupe -- /DRIVE MOMENTS
data.description: Wet.Dry. Wet again. With some dry bits. But also some wet. I'd done 6 laps of the circuit before the race. The car is worth £2m and this was easily the biggest driving challenge of my life. VMax on the straight is around 180mph.

data.title: The Porsche 918 Spyder Tested  - CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS
data.tags: Porsche 918 Spyder, test drive, Chris Harris, /Drive
data.description:
The plug-in hybrid, mid-engine hypercar: The Porsche 918 Spyder.

Tested by /DRIVE's Chris Harris at the Valencia circuit in the winter of 2013.  The Porsche 918 Spyder has come a long way since when we first saw it at the Geneva Motor Show in March 2010.   Competing against the Ferrari LaFerrari and McLaren P1, it is the cheapest of the trio of new hypercars at a base price of $845,000. 

The engine weights 140 kg according to Porsche and it delivers 608 horsepower (453 kW) at 8,500 rpm and 528 N·m (389 lbf·ft) of maximum torque. This is supplemented by two electric motors delivering an additional 279 hp (208 kW) - One 154 hp electric motor drives the rear wheels in parallel with the engine and also serves as the main generator.

data.title: First Drive: BMW i8 - /CHRIS HARRIS ON CARS
data.tags: BMW i8, /DRIVE, Chris Harris, first drive
data.description: Chris Harris takes a 24 hour trip to Los Angeles to drive the new BMW i8.  He hated the flight, but the i8 left a positive impression on the team.  Capable of 23 miles all electric before the 3-cylinder turbocharged motor kicks in to recharge the batteries. This is one of the closest production cars we've ever seen that looks almost identical to the concept car it's based on.
